text: Feedbacks (data and opinions) from customers/consumers are captured and stored in a customer/consumer data repository.
Feedbacks (data and opinions) from customers/consumers are continuously and automatically captured.
Feedbacks (data and opinions) from customers/consumers are used to improve products (enhance existing features and identify new ones).
The organization identifies new business opportunities based on automatically captured customer/consumer feedbacks.
Feedbacks (data and opinions) from customers/consumers are used for experimentation and innovation.
Experiments (e.g., A/B tests) are conducted with customers/consumers to improve products.
Technologies (e.g., cloud technologies) are adopted to enhance experimentation.
The organization continually experiments new technologies and methodologies.

The organization has a clear information flow between the strategic level and the development area, allowing customer/consumer data to be used in an aligned way in making technical and business decisions.
Data from the customer/consumer data repository is used in decision making by the software development area.
Data from the customer/consumer data repository is used in decision making by the business area.
Alignment between product development and the organization's business is maintained through continuous checks, in short cycles and based on customer/consumer data.
Knowledge management practices are adopted based on data from the customer/consumer data repository.
